text: <http://www.bizjournals.com/portland/blog/techflash/2016/10/digital-trends-lands-10m-credit-with-chase.html?ana=e_me_set1&s=newsletter&ed=2016-10-04&u=m9syYM7WALmtsZgZnc%2FXEw08da153c&t=1475591879&j=75996961>
Interest and opportunity are aligning. Good share, Marce.

<!here|@here> I met with Beam a bit yesterday to talk about plans for the space, costs, budget and initial spatial plans.  A quick capture of my notes in case you’re interested: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/document/d/18GJn4UzISLGr6QyCKyMtRT2L-NN8Eav5skgYAxxcYOM/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0ML49XU0|dennishanley> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/dennishanley/F2K7F3M89/proformadiscussionwithbeam_100316|ProForma Discussion with Beam_100316>
<@U0K8ZSHN0> and <@U026NB2U2> ally will be in touch about one of y’all (i nominated you) giving a 2 min overview of what we’re up to for pmmc at All Hands tomorrow

Hi Dennis. Thanks for sharing the notes from yesterdays conversation. I wonder what Beam has in mind for the restrooms. There is some plumbing in the front of the building as well as on the North Side next to elevator. 

In general. Are they waiting on tenant and architectural plans before they do anything?
I’m hoping they’ll restore rather than modernize. There were some great old industrial fixtures in there.

good points.  I think, in general, they’re planning to restore rather than modernize.  and also, i think they are waiting on tenant to do final architecture plans.  right now it’s just about maintaining and doing some general work they know the need to do (like remove fixtures but maybe not replace yet)
K, thanks
<!here|@here> we are waiting for the all clear that the sommely meeting has concluded
clear!!!
<!channel>

hey <!channel>,

thank was a rad session, thanks to Joel for setting up and facilitating.   

As Marce mentioned, there’s tremendous overlap, and now some nuance, with the spreadsheets he and I have drafted thus far.  
Take a look at em:
Biz model: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1opAxRqq2ZsM7glhblSmaUzKmRRx7Ity3G45yI22Zu-k/edit?usp=sharing>
Based on my original considerations: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1nPApYwF3bQrskP5wu-7wcKoUWHTKls8UQ13SJvnlIFg/edit?usp=sharing>

This meeting worked really well to bring us all on the same wave length.  See all the opportunities?  They’ll be refined and directed accordingly as we talk to potential partners.  

Next Steps:
- This week we need to evaluate the equipment on the MVS list.  Is this list sufficient; does it allow us to accomplish the things we’ve already identified.  If not, what are the limitations?  Spatially, does it kinda work with what we have?
I’ll set time for <@U0K8ZSHN0> <@U0HPGQ4KH> and <@U02E3CRMA> to discuss
- <@U026NB2U2> to confirm when Autodesk pitch is.  
- <@U02E3CRMA> to digitize and synthesize the outcome of this meeting.

text: <@U0ML49XU0|dennishanley> pinned a message to this channel.
<@U0ML49XU0|dennishanley> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/dennishanley/F2KB00T6G/pmmcproformabusinessmodel|PMMC Membership Model>
thanks
Just met w/ David Nichols from Automated Resources Group
they make software and machines that build machines.
they’re about 10 years old, based in the bay area, though he’s been up here w/ a team of 5 for several years.
Rick told him about PMMC and he gets it.
Is super interested in it - both as a renter of space (5 desks) 800 sq ft and in terms of machines and machine R&D (800 sq ft).
My action item is to send him our deck next week once we have stuff in it. Sounds like a pathway to other free machines if autodesk falls through.
Specifically they built the software for the flowjet water cutter
oh cool!  Added them to Ballpark doc - Competitor_Partner Tab

<@U0HPGQ4KH> and <@U0K8ZSHN0> when planning for space, the official Usable Square Feet:

 Fl 1: 4,180 

 Fl 2: 4,560 

 Fl 3: 4,560
Great. Thanks, sir
